    Methods in it.polimi.ingsw.model.Player.Effect with parameters of type Board 
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void BasicEffect.force​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn, Cell nextPosition)
    this method forces the pawn and return void because there is no consequence (victory or block) if you force a pawn
    void CanForceEffect.force​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn, Cell nextPosition)
    this method force the designatedPawn to the nextPosition base on the symmetrical force, then changes the state of the player to a MoveState
    void Effect.force​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn, Cell nextPosition)  
    void EffectDecorator.force​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn, Cell nextPosition)  
    java.util.List<Cell> BasicEffect.getOpponentsNeighboring​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn)
    this method returns the list of the cell where there are opponents pawn against designatedPawn
    java.util.List<Cell> CanForceEffect.getOpponentsNeighboring​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn)
    this method checks if the designatedPawn can force an opponent pawn to the space directly on the other side of the designatedPawn position if that space is unoccupied
    java.util.List<Cell> Effect.getOpponentsNeighboring​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn)  
    java.util.List<Cell> EffectDecorator.getOpponentsNeighboring​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn)  
    java.util.List<Action> BasicEffect.getPossibleActions​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn)
    return which are the possible actions that i can do with the selected pawn if i can't do any move with the pawn i lose the game, it's the basic possible action, it will by decorated according with the selected God card
    java.util.List<Action> Effect.getPossibleActions​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn)  
    java.util.List<Action> EffectDecorator.getPossibleActions​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn)  
    java.util.List<Building> BasicEffect.getPossibleBuildingOnCell​(Board gameBoard, Cell designatedCell)
    this method returns the list of possible building on the designatedCell
    java.util.List<Building> DomeBuildEffect.getPossibleBuildingOnCell​(Board gameBoard, Cell designatedCell)
    this is the same of basic method but it adds also the Dome building in order of apply Atlas Effects
    java.util.List<Building> Effect.getPossibleBuildingOnCell​(Board gameBoard, Cell designatedCell)  
    java.util.List<Building> EffectDecorator.getPossibleBuildingOnCell​(Board gameBoard, Cell designatedCell)  
    Consequence BasicEffect.move​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn, Cell nextPosition)
    the standard method that move designated pawn, it's the default move
    Consequence BlockOpponentEffect.move​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn, Cell nextPosition)
    This method is different from the basic one because the special effect for this player is that if a pawn moves up in his turn, for the next opponent's turns, the other players will not be able to move up
    Consequence BuildBeforeEffect.move​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn, Cell designatedCell)
    this method changes the state of the player after he does a basic move action
    Consequence CanForceEffect.move​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn, Cell nextPosition)
    this method changes the state of the player after he does a basic move action
    Consequence DownTwoEffect.move​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn, Cell nextPosition)
    this method is the same of basic player, but it return Victory Consequence also if player moves down to two levels
    Consequence Effect.move​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn, Cell nextPosition)  
    Consequence EffectDecorator.move​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn, Cell nextPosition)  
    Consequence MoreMoveEffect.move​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn, Cell nextPosition)
    This method decorates the player's effect based on his move for the current turn and changes his state For the first move the method will change the state to a MoveAndBuild, because after the first move the player could be able to move again
    Consequence MovePerimeterAgainEffect.move​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn, Cell nextPosition)
    This method is similar to basic, but the player can move again each time pawn moves onto perimeter space is so, after the player moved, the action "build" and also "move" are available For the end of the turn, it's only the action "finish"
    Consequence PushEffect.move​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn, Cell nextPosition)
    this method move pawn on nextposition cell and if the cell is occupied by a opponent pawn, it pushes this pawn in the same direction if is unoccupied
    Consequence SwitchEffect.move​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn, Cell nextPosition)
    this is the method that actually move the pawn, in case of switching with an opponent pawn this method force the opponent pawn in the designatedPawn starting cell
    void BasicEffect.placePawn​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn, Cell designatedCell)
    place the pawn on the board
    void Effect.placePawn​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn, Cell designatedCell)  
    void EffectDecorator.placePawn​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn, Cell designatedCell)  
    void BasicEffect.removePawn​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn)
    remove a pawn from the board
    void Effect.removePawn​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn)  
    void EffectDecorator.removePawn​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn)  
    java.util.List<Cell> BasicEffect.wherePawnCanBuild​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn)
    the standard method that return the cells where a pawn can build
    java.util.List<Cell> BuildInsideCellEffect.wherePawnCanBuild​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn)
    this method returns the cells where a pawn can build but if it's the second time to build, it removes the perimeter cells
    java.util.List<Cell> BuildNotOnSameCellEffect.wherePawnCanBuild​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn)
    this method deletes the cell where the player built in the first build action from the possible cells where to build again
    java.util.List<Cell> BuildOnSameCellEffect.wherePawnCanBuild​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn)
    this method adds the cell where the player built in the first build action to the possibles cells where to build again The added cell will be the only cell where tha player could build again
    java.util.List<Cell> CanBuildUnderItselfEffect.wherePawnCanBuild​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn)
    this method calculates all the possible cells where the designated pawn can build, adding the cell where the pawn itself is located, because with this decorator you can build under your own pawn
    java.util.List<Cell> Effect.wherePawnCanBuild​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn)  
    java.util.List<Cell> EffectDecorator.wherePawnCanBuild​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn)  
    java.util.List<Cell> BasicEffect.wherePawnCanDestroy​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn)
    the standard method that return the cells where I can destroy a block (not a dome)
    java.util.List<Cell> CanDestroyEffect.wherePawnCanDestroy​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn)
    this method controls where the not-moved pawn can destroy
    java.util.List<Cell> Effect.wherePawnCanDestroy​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn)  
    java.util.List<Cell> EffectDecorator.wherePawnCanDestroy​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn)  
    java.util.List<Cell> BasicEffect.wherePawnCanMove​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn)
    the standard method that return the cells where a pawn can move
    java.util.List<Cell> CanPushOpponentEffect.wherePawnCanMove​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn)
    wherePawnCanMove returns also cells occupied by opponent pawns in order to push it
    java.util.List<Cell> CanSwitchOpponentEffect.wherePawnCanMove​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn)
    wherePawnCanMove returns also cells occupied by opponent pawns in order to switch
    java.util.List<Cell> Effect.wherePawnCanMove​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn)  
    java.util.List<Cell> EffectDecorator.wherePawnCanMove​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn)  
    java.util.List<Cell> NotMoveBackEffect.wherePawnCanMove​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn)
    This method returns a list of cells where the pawn can move, except the starting cell of the turn of the designatedPawn
    java.util.List<Cell> NotMoveUpEffect.wherePawnCanMove​(Board gameBoard, Pawn designatedPawn)
    This method returns a list of cells where the pawn can move, except the cells that are higher than the pawn's cell
